errors.name: AlreadyAuthenticated
errors.description: The client is attempting to authenticate when already authenticated

errors.name: AuthenticationFailure
errors.description: The authentication process failed for some unexpected reason, see the message for further details

errors.name: AuthenticationNotApplicable
errors.description: Raised when the user does not support this method of authentication, see the message for further details

errors.name: BadSessionChallengeAnswer
errors.description: The given session challenge answer is incorrect or out of sync

errors.name: IncorrectLoginCredentials
errors.description: The given login credentials are incorrect

errors.name: IncorrectTwoFactorAuthenticationCode
errors.description: The given two-factor authentication code is incorrect

errors.name: NotAuthenticated
errors.description: Raised when the client attempts to invoke a method that requires authentication

errors.name: PrivateAccessTokenRequired
errors.description: Raised when the user/entity uses a Private Access Token to authenticate and the client attempted to authenticate in another way

errors.name: SessionExpired
errors.description: Raised when trying to use a session that has expired

errors.name: TwoFactorAuthenticationRequired
errors.description: Two-Factor Authentication is required, the client must repeat the same request but provide a Two-Factor authentication code as well

errors.name: AccessDenied
errors.description: The authenticated peer does not have sufficient permissions to access the requested resource or to invoke a restricted method

errors.name: AlreadyReposted
errors.description: Raised when the client attempts to repost a post that has already been reposted

errors.name: BlockedByPeer
errors.description: Raised when attempting to interact with a peer that blocked you

errors.name: BlockedPeer
errors.description: Raised when attempting to interact with a peer that you blocked

errors.name: DocumentNotFound
errors.description: The requested Document ID was not found on the server

errors.name: FileUploadError
errors.description: Raised when there was an error while trying to upload one or more files to the network

errors.name: PeerNotFound
errors.description: The requested user entity was not found in the network

errors.name: PostDeleted
errors.description: Raised when the client requested a post that was deleted

errors.name: PostNotFound
errors.description: Raised when the client requested a post that isn't found

errors.name: SelfInteractionNotPermitted
errors.description: Raised when attempting to invoke a method or change that involves a peer that you are authenticated as such as following a peer that you are authenticated as

errors.name: CaptchaAlreadyAnswered
errors.description: Raised when attempting to answer a captcha that has already been answered

errors.name: CaptchaAlreadyUsed
errors.description: Raised when the requested captcha has already been used

errors.name: CaptchaAnswerNotApplicable
errors.description: Raised when the captcha does not accept answers from the client

errors.name: DocumentUpload
errors.description: Raised when there was an error while trying to process the document upload

errors.name: InternalServerError
errors.description: Raised when there was an unexpected error while trying to process your request.

errors.name: AgreementRequired
errors.description: The client/user must agree to the condition to invoke the method

errors.name: FileTooLarge
errors.description: The given file is too large to be processed

errors.name: InvalidAttachments
errors.description: Raised when the given attachments are invalid

errors.name: InvalidBiography
errors.description: The Biography is too long or contains invalid characters, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidClientName
errors.description: The client name contains invalid characters or is too long, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidClientPrivateHash
errors.description: The client's private hash is invalid and cannot be identified as a sha256

errors.name: InvalidClientPublicHash
errors.description: The client's public hash is invalid and cannot be identified as a sha256

errors.name: InvalidFileForProfilePicture
errors.description: The given file is invalid for a profile picture

errors.name: InvalidFileName
errors.description: Raised when the given filename is invalid

errors.name: InvalidFileName
errors.description: Raised when the given filename is invalid

errors.name: InvalidGeoLocation
errors.description: The given geo location value is invalid or too long

errors.name: InvalidHelpDocumentId
errors.description: The given Help Document ID is invalid

errors.name: InvalidLastName
errors.description: The Last Name provided contains invalid characters and or is too long, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidPageValue
errors.description: The page parameter contains an invalid value. It cannot be a negative value or 0, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidPassword
errors.description: The given password is insecure, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidPeerInput
errors.description: The client provided an invalid peer identification as input

errors.name: InvalidPlatform
errors.description: The platform name contains invalid characters or is too long, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidPostText
errors.description: The post contains invalid characters or is too long, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidSessionIdentification
errors.description: The session identification object is invalid, see the message for further details

errors.name: InvalidUrlValue
errors.description: The given URL input is invalid

errors.name: InvalidUsername
errors.description: The given username is invalid and does not meet the specification

errors.name: InvalidVersion
errors.description: The version is invalid or is too long, see the message for further details

errors.name: TooManyAttachments
errors.description: Raised when the amount of attachments exceeds what the server supports

errors.name: UsernameAlreadyExists
errors.description: The username is already registered in the network and cannot be used

objects.name: DisplayPictureSize
objects.description: This object describes the size of a display picture followed by a document object that results in said display picture size.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the image

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the image

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: The document object that points to the display picture

objects.name: Document
objects.description: A document object contains basic information about the file associated with the document and the document ID used to retrieve the document from the CDN Server

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the document

parameters.name: file_mime
parameters.description: The Mime of the file

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: The original name of the file

parameters.name: file_size
parameters.description: The size of the file in bytes

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: The type of file detected by the server

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: An array of flags associated with this document

objects.name: ErrorDefinition
objects.description: The object ErrorDefinition contains information about an error that the server is capable of returning if a method fails to execute.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the ErrorDefinition, which is a crc32 hash of the following value; <ProtocolVersion>:<ErrorName>:<ErrorCode> (1.0:InternalServerError:16384)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the error, this is a unique value.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the error

parameters.name: error_code
parameters.description: The error code, this is a unique value.

objects.name: HelpDocument
objects.description: A help document is often retrieved from the server as a way to represent a document to the user for multiple purposes, from quick guides to server announcements or the legal documents required to be shown to the user before they register an account to the network.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the document, if the document gets updated then the ID will change

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text contents of the document

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: An array of text entities being represented in the text

objects.name: MethodDefinition
objects.description: The object MethodDefinition contains information about method, namespace, permission requirements and the parameters it accepts

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A crc32 hash of the methods's ID following the value; <ProtocolVersion>:<MethodName> eg; 1.0:timelime.compose

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the method e.g., timeline, network, etc.

parameters.name: method_name
parameters.description: The name of the method without the namespace compose, like, repost, etc.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The full name of the method with the leading namespace e.g. timeline.compose, timeline.like

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the method

parameters.name: permission_requirements
parameters.description: The array of permission requirements for this method

parameters.name: return_types
parameters.description: An array of possible return types

objects.name: ObjectDefinition
objects.description: The object ObjectDefinition explains the structure of a object that the server could return or work with.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A crc32 hash of the object's ID following the value; <ProtocolVersion>:<ObjectName> eg; 1.0:Peer

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the object

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the object

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: An array of ParameterDefinitions explaining the object structure

objects.name: ParameterDefinition
objects.description: The object ParameterDefinition contains information about the parameters used and or available, usually represented within an array; this object indicates the availabe types, name, description and requirement of the parameter. This can be applied to object property structures or method parameters

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the parameter

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: An array of types that are used for this parameter

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Indicates if this parameter is required or not, for objects this will always be true.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the parameter

objects.name: Peer
objects.description: A peer object provides a basic description and identification a peer entity that can contain information used to identify a peer on the client or basic flags and properties of the peer to pre-determine what actions are available for a peer.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the document, if the document gets updated then the ID will change

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the peer entity

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The display name of the peer

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username associated with this peer

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Flags associated with this peer

objects.name: Post
objects.description: A post object is used to represent a post submitted either by a peer, this object can contain recursive objects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the post

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The post type used to represent the true intention of the post

parameters.name: peer
parameters.description: The author peer of the post, this property can be null if the post was deleted.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source for where this post was composed from or collected from (eg; the client the user is using or the third-party source that the post was collected. This is determined by the server). This property can be null if the post was deleted.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text content of the post source. This property can be null if the post has been deleted

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: An array of attached documents to the post

parameters.name: entities
parameters.description: An array of entities extracted from the text, can be used by the client to highlight clickable entities that preforms an action.

parameters.name: mentioned_peers
parameters.description: An array of resolved peers that was mentioned in the post text.

parameters.name: reply_to_post
parameters.description: The original post that this post is replying to if applicable, otherwise null.

parameters.name: quoted_post
parameters.description: The original post that this post is quoting if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: reposted_post
parameters.description: The original post that this post is reposting if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: original_thread_post
parameters.description: The original thread post, only applicable to replies. This value indicates the main thread post where all the replies originated from. This value will remain the same for all sub-replies of the main post.

parameters.name: like_count
parameters.description: The amount of likes that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: repost_count
parameters.description: The amount of repost that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: quote_count
parameters.description: The amount of quoted posts that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: reply_count
parameters.description: The amount of replies that this post has if applicable, otherwise null

parameters.name: posted_timestamp
parameters.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this post was created

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: The flags associated with this post

objects.name: Profile
objects.description: The profile object provides a profile display for a peer entity, this is mainly used to represent a "Profile" display of a peer.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: The first name of the entity

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: The last name of the entity

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The full display name of the entity

parameters.name: biography
parameters.description: A biography or description of the entity

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of the entity

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the entity (Can be a website or a blog, etc)

parameters.name: followers_count
parameters.description: The amount of followers that this entity has

parameters.name: following_count
parameters.description: The amount of peers that this entity is following

parameters.name: display_picture_sizes
parameters.description: An array of display picture size objects that represents the entity's display picture

objects.name: ProtocolDefinitions
objects.description: The ProtocolDefinitions object contains object definitions of what the server's version of the protocol has defined and what their use cases are. Much like a documentation representation in a object structure that can be understood by clients which allows for constructors during runtime.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the protocol being used by the server, eg; 1.0

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: A list of error definitions defined by the server and protocol with their respective error codes and descriptions

parameters.name: objects
parameters.description: A list of object definitions defined by the server and protocol with their respective descriptions, names and parameters.

parameters.name: methods
parameters.description: A list of method definitions defined by the server and protocol with their respective descriptions, names and parameters.

objects.name: ServerInformation
objects.description: The ServerInformation object is a simple object that gives details about the server's attributes and limits or location of other servers that the client should communicate to for other purposes such as a CDN.

parameters.name: network_name
parameters.description: The name of the network, eg; "Socialvoid"

parameters.name: protocol_version
parameters.description: The version of the protocol standard that the server is using, eg; "1.0"

parameters.name: cdn_server
parameters.description: The HTTP URL Endpoint for the CDN server of the network

parameters.name: upload_max_file_size
parameters.description: The maximum size of a file that you can upload to the CDN Server (in bytes)

parameters.name: unauthorized_session_ttl
parameters.description: The maximum time-to-live (in seconds) that an unauthorized session may have. The server will often reset the expiration whenever the session is used.

parameters.name: authorized_session_ttl
parameters.description: The maximum time-to-live (in seconds) that an authorized session may have. The server will often reset the expiration whenever the session is used.

parameters.name: retrieve_likes_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of likes a client can retrieve at once using the method timeline.get_likes via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_reposts_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of reposts a client can retrieve at once using the method timeline.get_reposted_peers via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_replies_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of replies a client can retrieve at once using the method timeline.get_replies via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_quotes_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of quotes a client can retrieve at once using the method timeline.get_quotes via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_followers_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of followers a client can retrieve at once using the method network.get_followers via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_following_max_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of following peers a client can retrieve at once using the method network.get_following via the page parameter

parameters.name: retrieve_feed_max_limit
parameters.description: The amount of posts a client can retrieve at once using the method timeline.retrieve_feed via the page parameter

objects.name: Session
objects.description: A session object is contains basic information about the session.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: An array of flags that has been set to this session

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: An array of permission sets that has been set to this session

parameters.name: authenticated
parameters.description: Indicates if the session is currently authenticated to a user

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this session was first created

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The Unix Timestamp for when this session expires

objects.name: SessionEstablished
objects.description: A SessionEstablished object is returned when you create a session. This object returns basic information about the session that the server has created for you.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: The TOTP based challenge secret

objects.name: SessionIdentification
objects.description: A SessionIdentification object allows your client to identify the session it's using and prove that it is the owner of the session, it proves as a identification effort and security effort.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the session obtained when establishing a session

parameters.name: challenge
parameters.description: The TOTP based challenge secret

objects.name: TextEntity
objects.description: The text entity object describes the text type, this is useful for clients to render the given text correctly. For example a "@mention" will have a TextEntity with the value mention. So that the client can perform an action when this entity is clicked.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The text entity type

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for when the entity begins in the text

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The length of the entity

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the entity, for styling entities such as BOLD, ITALIC, etc. this value will be null, but for values such as MENTION, HASHTAG & URL the value will contain the respective value for the entity, for example a URL entity will contain a value of a http URL

objects.name: TypeDefinition
objects.description: The object TypeDefinition contains information about the defined type, the vector property can indicate if the type is being represented is a vector (list/array) and should be iterated

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of the value, can either be a builtin type or one of the pre-defined object being represented as a string, eg; string, Peer, null

parameters.name: vector
parameters.description: An array of types that are used for this parameterIndicates if the type is represented as a vector or not (List/Array)

methods.description: Clears the biography set to the user profile

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

methods.description: Clears the peers URL/Website from the profile

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

methods.description: Deletes the current profile picture and reverts back to the default profile picture generated by the server.

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

methods.description: Sets a new profile picture to the user from a Document ID

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: The ID of the document to retrieve from the server and set as the profile picture, the document must be a type PHOTO

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: biography
parameters.description: The biography text to set to the users profile

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location text to set to the users profile

methods.description: Sets a new First and or Last name to the profile

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: The first name to set to the profile

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: The last name to set to the profile (Optional)

parameters.name: session_identification
parameters.description: The Session Identification object

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to apply to the profile
